name.text: WINTER BEER FLIGHT + YOGA @ Traveler Montlake
name.html: WINTER BEER FLIGHT + YOGA @ Traveler Montlake

description.text:
We have made it our mission to combat the infamous Seattle Freeze and get people moving their bodies. We put our heads together and one day the light bulb went off. What better way to get people together then to combine two of our favorite things, Beer and Yoga!  The morning begins with an hour long, all levels, Yoga practice. Immediately following our practice we will move to the bar for your choice of a Winter Beer Flight or mimosa and brunch. Leave your worries at the door, get your body in motion, taste some of Seattle's finest craft beers, and get to know your community. 
Details:
Doors open at 10:30 am. 
Bring along a mat and water bottle. 
  About the Venue: The Traveler Montlake is a place to meet your friends and family to enjoy the quality atmosphere, service, food and drink. This neighboorhood pub is the place to be. Traveler Montlake has two other locations; the Leary Traveler and the Great Nabob. We could not imagined a better location to get this thing started. 
 
FAQs
 
Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event?
Yes. You must be 21 to attend this event. 

What should I bring?
A Yoga mat, water bottle and an attitude of gratitude

What can't I bring to the event?
Your dog and your kids. This is an adult-only outing.
 
What are my transport/parking options getting to the event?
Street Parking is available. Make sure to look out for no parking zones and timed parking areas. No one wants a parking ticket. Using Uber, public transportation, biking, etc is highly encouraged! 

Where can I contact the organizer with any questions?
Sure thing! Hit us up at cheers@justaddyogaevents.com with any questions. 
 
Is my ticket transferrable?
We do not offer refunds, but yes, tickets are abosolutely transferrable. 
 
Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event?
Nope. In fact, we encourage you to use your moblie ticket. No need for trees to die on our behalf. 
 
What is the refund policy?
We do not offer refunds. However, all tickets are transferrable.

description.text:
We have made it our mission to combat the infamous Seattle Freeze and get people moving their bodies. We put our heads together and one day the light bulb went off. What better way to get people together then to combine two of our favorite things, Beer and Yoga!  The morning begins with an hour long, all levels, Yoga practice. Taught by 8 Limbs Yoga, Jay Holby.  Immediately following our practice we will move to the bar for your choice of pint. Leave your worries at the door, get your body in motion, taste some of Seattle's finest craft beers, and get to know your community. 
Details:
Doors open at 10:00 am. 
Bring along a mat and water bottle. 
 About the Venue: Hellbent Brewing was voted Lake City Future First and the Lake City Neighborhood Alliance for Small Business of the Year and a finalist for Best Brewpub in the Best Of Western Washington contest. Hellbent Brewing compnay is a place to grab your favorite micro brew, they have 20 taps to choose from, make new friends and think big thoughts.
About the Instructor: Jay Holby grew up around yoga with trips to Kripalu Yoga Center on the east coast as a kid. His mother Karen has taught Kripalu style yoga for close to 40 years in his home state of Ohio. After competing in track and soccer as an intercollegiate athlete, Jay was initially drawn to the physical aspects of yoga. In 1995 he started a career in personal training and has been helping people of all fitness levels lead more active, enjoyable lives. Jay believes there is room in everyone's practice for humor and laughter, hard work and dedication, patience and acceptance. 
FAQs
 
Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event?
Yes. You must be 21 to attend this event. 

What should I bring?
A Yoga mat, water bottle and an attitude of gratitude

What can't I bring to the event?
Your dog and your kids. This is an adult-only outing.
 
What are my transport/parking options getting to the event?
There is a designated parking lot which holds about 20-25 cars. Street parking is also available.

Where can I contact the organizer with any questions?
Sure thing! Hit us up at cheers@justaddyogaevents.com with any questions.

description.text:
We have made it our mission to combat the infamous Seattle Freeze and get people moving their bodies. We put our heads together and one day the light bulb went off. What better way to get people together then to combine two of our favorite things, Booze and Yoga!
The afternoon starts off with a hour long, all levels yoga class, taught by Just Add Yoga Events Co-Founder, Jess Fleming. Class will be held overlooking the city on the amazing rooftop deck of the Fremont Foundry. Immediately following class you will recieve early access to the VIP lounge, hosting unlimted snacks and drinks throughout the day, as well as 3 tasting tokens for the main event. 
About The Northwest Tequila Fest:
Northwest Tequila Fest is first and foremost a tasting event. Each one of our 130+ bottles of tequila, mezcal and sotol are available for you to sample! With the purchase of your Tequila + Yoga ticket you will receive 3  tastes, tastes will be .5 oz each (1/3 of a shot).  Water will be plentiful to keep hydrated, and we encourage folks to take their time and enjoy each delicious drop! Your tastes are also good for Cocktails and Beer, which will be available throughout the festival. And if you run out of them, not a problem! You will be able to purchase more the day of the Fest.
FAQs  Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event?  Yes. You must be 21 to attend this event.  What should I bring?  A Yoga mat, water bottle and an attitude of gratitude  What can't I bring to the event?  Your dog and your kids. This is an adult-only outing.  What are my transport/parking options getting to the event?  Street parking in available, however, we do reccomend carpooling or taking public transit when possible  Where can I contact the organizer with any questions?  Hit us up at cheers@justaddyogaevents.com with any questions.  Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event?  Nope. In fact, we encourage you to use your mobile ticket. No need for trees to die on our behalf.  What is the refund policy?  We do not offer refunds.

description.text:
The morning begins with an hour long, all levels, Yoga practice. Immediately following our practice we will move to the bar for a pint of your favorite Spinnaker Bay brew. Leave your worries at the door, get your body in motion, taste some of Seattle's finest craft beers, and get to know your community. 
About the Venue: Spinnaker Bay Brewing, founded in 2012 by Janet Spindler and Elissa Pryor, is currently Washington state’s only 100% woman founded and owned microbrewery. Located in the Hillman City neighborhood of Seattle, they create big flavorful beers with attitude..
 FAQs
 Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event?
Yes. You must be 21 to attend this event. 
What should I bring?
A Yoga mat, water bottle and an attitude of gratitude
What time do doors open?
Doors open at 10am, we advise arriving early to give you a chance to set up your mat and get to know those around you
Can I bring my children?
We love the little ones, but our yoga practice adults only activity. Children are welcome to join post yoga practice.
What are my transport/parking options getting to the event?
There is a designated parking lot which holds about 15 cars. Street parking is also available. 
Where can I contact the organizer with any questions?
cheers@justaddyogaevents.com .
Is my ticket transferrable? 
 No, tickets are not transferrable
Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event?
Nope. In fact, we encourage you to use your moblie ticket. Save the trees!  
 What is the refund policy?
We do not offer refunds.

description.text:
The morning begins with an hour long, all levels, Yoga practice. Immediately following our practice we will move to the bar a pint of your favorite cider. Leave your worries at the door, get your body in motion, taste some of Seattle's finest craft cider, and get to know your community. 
About the Venue:   In 1867, Transcontinental Tunnel Number 6 finally broke through solid granite after 2 years of hand picks, dynamite, willpower and a startling disregard for safety. Number Six was the most deadly and ambitious railway tunnel ever built. What used to take 25 days to cross, now could be done in a matter of hours. People, materials, and cider now flowed freely. Number 6 Hard Cider is a tribute to hard fought progress and the connections it creates. Come taste thei flagship True Cider and crafted seasonal releases at their rail-side cidery and taproom. 100% Washington apples and a relentless toil for perfect taste is what they're made of. Raise a cold, crisp pint to progress. Onward!
 FAQs
 Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event?
Yes. You must be 21 to attend this event.

A Yoga mat, water bottle and an attitude of gratitude

We love the little ones, but this is an adults only activity
What are my transport/parking options getting to the event?
There is a parking lot in front of the venue

The morning begins with an hour long, all levels, Yoga practice. Immediately following our practice we will move to the bar a pint of your favorite Dirty Bucket brew. Leave your worries at the door, get your body in motion, taste some of Seattle's finest craft beers, and get to know your community. 
About the Venue: Dirty Bucket Brewing Co. started over exactly that; a dirty bucket. Brewing in the garage and pondering the idea of creating a place where they could share their beers and passion for creating them. After taking that leap of faith towards brewing as a profession they needed a name. Holding true to their "Home Brewing" roots the name Dirty Bucket Brewing Co. was tossed up they realized there truly was no other name that better describes our passion. By creating smaller batches they are able to maintain an intimate level of craftsmanship and rotate different styles of beers more frequently giving customers a wide range of beers to choose from

description.text:
The morning begins with an hour long, all levels, Yoga practice. Taught by Breathe Yoga's, Lizzie Braicks. Immediately following our practice we will move to the bar for a pint of your favorite Ghostfish brew. Leave your worries at the door, get your body in motion, taste some of Seattle's finest gluten free craft beers, and get to know your community. 
About the Venue:  Ghostfish Brewing Company is a brewery with a mission: to elevate gluten-free beer to the forefront of craft brewing innovation. All three of the founders are gluten-intolerant themselves or have loved ones who are, making them acutely aware of how the craft brewing revolution has left gluten-intolerant drinkers behind. They combine traditional brewing methods with non-traditional ingredients in a constantly evolving repertoire of beer styles. 
 About thr Instructor: Lizzie is a Seattle yoga instructor and blogger. She came to yoga after a slew of injuries from her D1 rowing days left her achy and in need of a new physical challenge. The effect it had on her inspired her to teach. So, she became certified and has never looked back. Lizzie's classes tend to be athletic, goofy, challenging, and envigorating. When she's not chugging coffee or taking pictures of her dog, you can find Lizzie teaching at Breathe Hot Yoga on Cap Hill.

description.html:
The morning begins with an hour long, all levels, Yoga practice. Taught by Breathe Yoga's, Lizzie Braicks. Immediately following our practice we will move to the bar for a pint of your favorite Ghostfish brew. Leave your worries at the door, get your body in motion, taste some of Seattle's finest gluten free craft beers, and get to know your community.

About the Venue:  Ghostfish Brewing Company is a brewery with a mission: to elevate gluten-free beer to the forefront of craft brewing innovation. All three of the founders are gluten-intolerant themselves or have loved ones who are, making them acutely aware of how the craft brewing revolution has left gluten-intolerant drinkers behind. They combine traditional brewing methods with non-traditional ingredients in a constantly evolving repertoire of beer styles.

 About thr Instructor: Lizzie is a Seattle yoga instructor and blogger. She came to yoga after a slew of injuries from her D1 rowing days left her achy and in need of a new physical challenge. The effect it had on her inspired her to teach. So, she became certified and has never looked back. Lizzie's classes tend to be athletic, goofy, challenging, and envigorating. When she's not chugging coffee or taking pictures of her dog, you can find Lizzie teaching at Breathe Hot Yoga on Cap Hill. 

FAQs

 Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event?

Yes. You must be 21 to attend this event.

What should I bring?

A Yoga mat, water bottle and an attitude of gratitude

What time do doors open?

Doors open at 10am, we advise arriving early to give you a chance to set up your mat and get to know those around you

Can I bring my children?

We love the little ones, but this is an adults only activity

What are my transport/parking options getting to the event?

Street parking is available.

Where can I contact the organizer with any questions?

cheers@justaddyogaevents.com .

Is my ticket transferrable?

 No, tickets are not transferrable

Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event?

Nope. In fact, we encourage you to use your moblie ticket. Save the trees! 

 What is the refund policy?

We do not offer refunds.

description.text:
The morning begins with an hour long, all levels, Yoga practice. Immediately following our practice we will move to the bar a pint of your favorite cider. Leave your worries at the door, get your body in motion, taste some of Seattle's finest craft cider, and get to know your community. 
About Number 6:   In 1867, Transcontinental Tunnel Number 6 finally broke through solid granite after 2 years of hand picks, dynamite, willpower and a startling disregard for safety. Number Six was the most deadly and ambitious railway tunnel ever built. What used to take 25 days to cross, now could be done in a matter of hours. People, materials, and cider now flowed freely. Number 6 Hard Cider is a tribute to hard fought progress and the connections it creates. Come taste their flagship True Cider and crafted seasonal releases at their rail-side cidery and taproom. 100% Washington apples and a relentless toil for perfect taste is what they're made of. Raise a cold, crisp pint to progress. Onward!
Yoga will take place in the Six Spirits distillery. After, we will move to Citizen Six for a Number 6 cider tasting and snacks.

description.text:
We have made it our mission to combat the infamous Seattle Freeze and get people moving their bodies. We put our heads together and one day the light bulb went off. What better way to get people together then to combine two of our favorite things, Beer and Yoga!Join us for an hour long, all levels, Yoga practice. Immediately following our practice we will move to the bar for your choice of pint. Leave your worries at the door, get your body in motion, taste some of Seattle's finest craft beers, and get to know your community.
Details:
Doors open at 10:15 am.
Bring along a mat and water bottle. 
About the Venue: Hellbent Brewing was voted Lake City Future First and the Lake City Neighborhood Alliance for Small Business of the Year and a finalist for Best Brewpub in the Best Of Western Washington contest. Hellbent Brewing compnay is a place to grab your favorite micro brew, they have 20 taps to choose from, make new friends and think big thoughts.

FAQs
 
Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event?
Yes. You must be 21 to attend this event. 

What should I bring?
A Yoga mat, water bottle and an attitude of gratitude

Can I bring my dog to the event?
Yes! You will need to leave your pooch outside during the Yoga class, but after that, by all means bring your pup in to hang out! 
 
What are my transport/parking options getting to the event?
There is a designated parking lot which holds about 20-25 cars. Street parking is also available.

Where can I contact the organizer with any questions?
Hit us up at cheers@justaddyogaevents.com with any questions. 
 
 Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event?
Nope. In fact, we encourage you to use your moblie ticket. No need for trees to die on our behalf. 
 
What is the refund policy?
We do not offer transfers or refunds.

All three of the founders are gluten-intolerant themselves or have loved ones who are, making them acutely aware of how the craft brewing revolution has left gluten-intolerant drinkers behind. description.text:
We have made it our mission to combat the infamous Seattle Freeze and get people moving their bodies. We put our heads together and one day the light bulb went off. What better way to get people together then to combine two of our favorite things, Beer and Yoga! Now we are throwing in another favorite thing, hiking!!   We love getting out into the great outdoors and taking in all the beauty the PacNW has to offer. We hope you will join us for a hike to Snow Lake. The plan is to meet at the Park N Ride on Mercer Island and carpool to the trailhead. Following our hike we will grab our mats and meet at the base for an, all levels, Yoga practice. Once we are feeling all loosey goosey, we will head down to Dru Bru for a nice cold pint of your favorite beer. You will have the option to order lunch from Commonwealth (not included), before heading back to Seattle.   Details: 8am - Leave from the Mercer Island Park N Ride  9am- Begin the hike  12pm- Yoga Class (times may vary)  1pm - Head to Dru Bru   About the Hike - Snow Lake is a 7 mile round trip hike, this hike is ranked moderate, beautiful views of Snoqualamie valley and the largest of the Alpine Lakes make the sweat well worth it! For more information visit,  http://bit.ly/1Wcrnlu , 
About Dru Bru: Our beers are European-inspired and uniquely sessionable – designed to showcase deep flavors in an approachable package. Using unfiltered Snoqualmie Pass mountain water, imported German malts and Yakima Valley hops we craft beers that are distinctly Dru Bru.   FAQs   Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event?  All ages are welcome    What should I bring?  A Yoga mat, water, trail snacks and an attitude of gratitude   Can I bring my dog to the event?  Yes! You will need to leave your pooch tied up during the Yoga class, but your well behaved, people and other dog friendly pooch is welcome to join on the hike and for beers after.    What are my transport/parking options getting to the event? We will meet at the Mercer Island Park N Ride, and car pool from there  Where can I contact the organizer with any questions?  Hit us up at cheers@justaddyogaevents.com with any questions.    Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event?  Nope. In fact, we encourage you to use your moblie ticket. No need for trees to die on our behalf.    What is the refund policy?  We do not offer transfers or refunds.

description.text:
The morning begins with an hour long, all levels, Yoga practice. Immediately following our practice we will move to the bar for a pint of your favorite Oktoberfest brew. Leave your worries at the door, get your body in motion, taste some delicious beer straight from Munich, and get to know your community. Come for the Beer + Yoga, stay all day! Queen Anne Beer Hall has a day full of awesome events planned, including some fun for the kiddos.  
About the Venue:  The Queen Anne Beerhall brings an authentic beer hall experience to Seattle. It is a tradition that Europeans have enjoyed for centuries - communal tables where friends and strangers mingle in a lively, friendly atmosphere, energized by a regular schedule of live music. The establishment features a 7,000 square foot hall, 25 premium draft beers and over 50 bottles. The bar offers unique cocktails made with in-house prepared syrups and shrubs. The menu includes classic beer hall fare with Pacific Northwest influences.  Don’t miss perfectly executed staples such as soft Bavarian pretzel, wiener schnitzel and a variety of grilled sausages with sauerkraut. The Queen Anne Beerhall is a place to gather, to experience incredible food, music and community.
 FAQs
Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event?
Yes. You must be 21 to attend this event. 
What should I bring?
A Yoga mat, water bottle and an attitude of gratitude
What time do doors open?
Doors open at 9:45 am, we advise arriving early to give you a chance to set up your mat and get to know those around you
Can I bring my children?
We love the little ones, but this is an adults only activity, children are welcome to join after class
Can I bring my dog?
Sorry, pooches need to stay at home 
What are my transport/parking options getting to the event?
Free parking available 
Where can I contact the organizer with any questions?
cheers@justaddyogaevents.com .
Is my ticket transferrable? 
No, tickets are not transferrable
Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event?
Nope. In fact, we encourage you to use your moblie ticket. Save the trees!  
What is the refund policy?
We do not offer refunds.

name.text: Beer + Yoga Sends Kory to VETOGA
name.html: Beer + Yoga Sends Kory to VETOGA

description.text:
This is a very special class. The proceeds of this class will go towards helping a pretty rad member of the Just Add Yoga community achieve her goals. As a vetern of the US Army Reserves, Kory, is planning to attend Vetoga 200 hour Teacher Training program in DC. Current research has found that yoga and community involvement have a direct impact on the reduction of post-traumatic stress in veterans, as well as generally increasing overall mental well-being.This teacher training equips veterans with the holistic tools and teachings to pass on the healing benefits of yoga to their veteran communities.  
If you are unable to attend and would like to contribute or if you would like to learn more about Kory and Vetoga, please visit: https://donate.vetoga.org/kory. 
About the Venue:  Ghostfish Brewing Company is a brewery with a mission: to elevate gluten-free beer to the forefront of craft brewing innovation. All three of the founders are gluten-intolerant themselves or have loved ones who are, making them acutely aware of how the craft brewing revolution has left gluten-intolerant drinkers behind. They combine traditional brewing methods with non-traditional ingredients in a constantly evolving repertoire of beer styles.

description.text:
The evening begins with an hour long, all levels, Vinyasa Flow Yoga practice, designed to calm the senses. Following our practice we will enjoy a tasting of Elsom Cellars wines. Leave your worries at the door, get your body in motion, enjoy delicious wine, and laugh with new friends and old.  
About the venue: Elsom Cellars classifies their wines as Northwest Wines. After all, they are made with Northwest grapes. Hand-crafted, carefully-nurtured grapes from growers with proven consistency and pride. Once selected, we truck the grapes to our winery and crush them. Within hours of receiving them. Late night, early morning — doesn’t matter. Crush them, age them, filter and barrel them. Turn Northwest grapes into Northwest wine. Exclusively bottled wines that offer distinctive flavours, borne of a singular desire – to create the quintessential gesture of hospitality – a great bottle of wine. Elsom Cellars will offer Wine + Yoga guest 10% off all bottles during the event

description.text:
We have made it our mission to combat the infamous Seattle Freeze and get people moving their bodies. We put our heads together and one day the light bulb went off. What better way to get people together then to combine two of our favorite things, Beer and Yoga!Join us for an hour long, all levels, Yoga practice. Immediately following our practice we will move to the bar for your choice of pint. Leave your worries at the door, get your body in motion, taste some of Seattle's finest craft beers, and get to know your community.
Details:
Doors open at 10:15 am.
Bring along a mat and water bottle. 
About the Venue: Hellbent Brewing was voted Lake City Future First and the Lake City Neighborhood Alliance for Small Business of the Year and a finalist for Best Brewpub in the Best Of Western Washington contest. Hellbent Brewing company is a place to grab your favorite micro brew, with 20 taps to choose from, make new friends and think big thoughts.

FAQs
 
Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event?
Yes. You must be 21 to attend this event. 

What should I bring?
A Yoga mat, water bottle and an attitude of gratitude

Can I bring my dog to the event?
Yes! You will need to leave your pooch outside during the Yoga class, but after that, by all means bring your pup in to hang out! 
 
What are my transport/parking options getting to the event?
There is a designated parking lot which holds about 20-25 cars. Street parking is also available.

Where can I contact the organizer with any questions?
Hit us up at cheers@justaddyogaevents.com with any questions. 
 
 Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event?
Nope. In fact, we encourage you to use your moblie ticket. No need for trees to die on our behalf. 
 
What is the refund policy?
We do not offer transfers or refunds.

Leave your worries at the door, get your body in motion, taste some of Seattle's finest craft beers, and get to know your community. 
About the Venue: Dirty Bucket Brewing Co. started over exactly that; a dirty bucket. Brewing in the garage and pondering the idea of creating a place where they could share their beers and passion for creating them. After taking that leap of faith towards brewing as a profession they needed a name. Holding true to their "Home Brewing" roots the name Dirty Bucket Brewing Co. was tossed up they realized there truly was no other name that better describes our passion. By creating smaller batches they are able to maintain an intimate level of craftsmanship and rotate different styles of beers more frequently giving customers a wide range of beers to choose from

description.text:
Join us as we move our bodies, enjoy a beer and make new friends. Just Add Yoga is joining forces with FUEL house and MiiR Flagship to raise money for an amazing foundation, Candlelighters. We will start the morning with 45 minutes of FUELstrong, the ultimate strength and conditioning class, followed by 45 minutes of all level Vinyasa Flow. Immediately after class we will head to MiiR for a beer, to chat, celebrate the holiday season, and get to know one another. 100% of the proceeds of this event will go to the many families that Candlelighters of Western WA supports. 
About the foundation:Candlelighters of Western WA is a non-profit organization, providing support to over a thousand families affected by childhood cancer in Oregon and SW Washington. Recognizing various needs of individuals and families, we offer our support and services, without regard to economics, race, religion, choice of physician(s) or health care facilities. 
To learn more, visit: http://www.candlelighterswa.org/About FUELhouse: 
This isn’t just a gym. It’s a gathering place–a tribe of people who want to live healthier lives, and who enjoy helping others do the same. We’re parents, couples, singles, young, old and everything in between. We know who we are, and we like who we are.At FUELhouse, you’ll find programming that’s as hard (often harder) than anybody’s. But we’re not striving to push you beyond your comfort zone, and we’re not trying to put people into competitions. We represent an entire fitness family supporting you every step of the way. After all, the stronger you are, the stronger we are. That’s just how this whole community thing works.To learn more, visit: http://www.fuelhousegym.com/About MiiR: 
The MiiR Flagship. It's for you. For your friends. We've created a place for people to connect, converse, learn, and grow. We mix MiiR hard goods, superb coffee, a huge selection of beers on tap, food to sustain you, information on the MiiR Give and community.Each and every product, beverage and food item you purchase at the Flagship supports the MiiR give - 5% of our revenues fund trackable giving projects.To learn more, vist: https://www.miir.com/pages/flagship

FAQs  Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event?  You must be 21 to purchase the Beer + FUELstrong Yoga ticket, 18 and over to purchase FUELstrong + Yoga only  What should I bring?  A Yoga mat, water bottle and an attitude of gratitude  What time do doors open?  Doors open at 10am, we advise arriving early to give you a chance to set up your mat and get to know those around you  Can I bring my children?  We love the little ones, but this is an adults only activity  What are my transport/parking options getting to the event? There is a small lot and limited street parking, we advise car pooling and public transit when available   Where can I contact the organizer with any questions?  cheers@justaddyogaevents.com .  Is my ticket transferrable?  No, tickets are not transferrable  Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event?  Nope. In fact, we encourage you to use your moblie ticket. Save the trees!   What is the refund policy?  We do not offer refunds.

name.text: Mini Golf Beer + Yoga @ Flatstick Pub Kirkland
name.html: Mini Golf Beer + Yoga @ Flatstick Pub Kirkland

description.text:
The morning begins with an hour long, all levels, Yoga practice. Following our practice we will move to the bar for a pint of your favorite local brew or cider! 
Included in your ticket price is a round of mini golf, feel free to hit the green, or you can save your voucher for another time. Leave your worries at the door, get your body in motion, taste some delicious beer and get to know our community. 
About the venue: There are only two rules at Flatstick Pub: drink local and have fun. They are mixing up the scene by combining local beers with an indoor 9-hole mini golf course and other unique games. Their rotating taps feature Washington-only beers and ciders, and the variety never ends as they continue to make friends with craft breweries all over Washington.

FAQs  Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event? Children are allowed in the Kirland location until 7pm, must be 16 or older to participate in the yoga portion of the day  What should I bring?  A Yoga mat, water bottle and an attitude of gratitude  What time do doors open?  Doors open at 10 am, we advise arriving early to give you a chance to set up your mat and get to know those around you 
Can I bring my dog? Dogs are welcome for the post yoga portion of the day  What are my transport/parking options getting to the event?  Street parking available  Where can I contact the organizer with any questions?  cheers@justaddyogaevents.com  Is my ticket transferrable?  No, tickets are not transferrable  Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event?  Nope. In fact, we encourage you to use your mobile ticket. Save the trees!   What is the refund policy?  We do not offer refunds.

description.text:
The morning begins with an hour long, all levels, Yoga practice. Immediately following our practice we will move to the bar for a pint of your favorite draft brew. Leave your worries at the door, get your body in motion, taste some delicious beer and get to know your community.  
About the Venue:  The Queen Anne Beerhall brings an authentic beer hall experience to Seattle. It is a tradition that Europeans have enjoyed for centuries - communal tables where friends and strangers mingle in a lively, friendly atmosphere, energized by a regular schedule of live music. The establishment features a 7,000 square foot hall, 25 premium draft beers and over 50 bottles. The bar offers unique cocktails made with in-house prepared syrups and shrubs. The menu includes classic beer hall fare with Pacific Northwest influences.  Don’t miss perfectly executed staples such as soft Bavarian pretzel, wiener schnitzel and a variety of grilled sausages with sauerkraut. The Queen Anne Beerhall is a place to gather, to experience incredible food, music and community.

name.text: Just Add Yoga 1 Year Anniversary @ Hellbent Brewing Company
name.html: Just Add Yoga 1 Year Anniversary @ Hellbent Brewing Company

description.text:
One year ago, we made it our mission to combat the infamous Seattle Freeze and get people moving their bodies. After many beers and brunches spent trying to figure out a fun way to make our mission a reality, one day the light bulb went off. What better way to get people together then to combine two of our favorite things, Beer and Yoga!Join us as we celebrate! The morning begins with an hour long, all levels, Yoga practice. Immediately following our practice we will move to the bar for your choice of favorite Hellbent brew. Leave your worries at the door, get your body in motion, taste some of Seattle's finest craft beers, and get to know your community.!
Details:
Doors open at 10:15 am.
Bring along a mat and water bottle. 
About the Venue: Hellbent Brewing was voted Lake City Future First and the Lake City Neighborhood Alliance for Small Business of the Year and a finalist for Best Brewpub in the Best Of Western Washington contest. Hellbent Brewing company is a place to grab your favorite micro brew, with 20 taps to choose from, make new friends and think big thoughts.

FAQs
Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event?
Yes. You must be 21 to attend this event. 
What should I bring?
A Yoga mat, water bottle and an attitude of gratitude
Can I bring my dog to the event?
Yes! You will need to leave your pooch outside during the Yoga class, but after that, by all means bring your pup in to hang out! 
 What are my transport/parking options getting to the event?
There is a designated parking lot which holds about 20-25 cars. Street parking is also available.
Where can I contact the organizer with any questions?
Hit us up at cheers@justaddyogaevents.com with any questions. 
Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event?
Nope. In fact, we encourage you to use your mobile ticket. No need for trees to die on our behalf. 
What is the refund policy?
We do not offer transfers or refunds.

description.text:
The morning begins with an hour long, all levels, Yoga practice. Immediately following our practice we will move to the bar for a pint of your favorite craft brew, with 50 taps to choose from, you can't go wrong! Leave your worries at the door, get your body in motion, taste some delicious beer and get to know your community.  About the Venue:





Located in the South Lake Union, North Belltown area of Seattle, husband and wife duo, Rich Powell and Karrie Stewart were inspired by the beauty and functionality of the TeKu Glass and aim to elevate the beer scene in Seattle. They have taken their love of beer and high quality standards to create a space for the ultimate experience in beer tasting, shopping, and sharing. TeKu Tavern prides itself on being knowledgeable proprietors of beer; ensuring proper storage, care, and presentation so it can be enjoyed as intended by the product's creators.
